string.text: Weapon in slot one repair cost:
Weapon in slot two repair cost:
Armour repair cost:
Let's see your prices.
Sidorovich, I see, you do repair stuff from time to time, don't you?

Ah... you are talking about that thing in the vice? Yeah, it gonna be a good gun. And expensive. So, what do you need to be repaired? But I'm warning you: it's very expensive. The more the wear is, the more is the price. So?
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armour.
Damn, I'm short of money. Talk about it later.
Now... in a blink of an eye it will be done...\nFinished with it, here you are!
Yeah... Marked One, you've been battered indeed...\nWell... I had some armour plates somewhere here... aha, here they are... Now, it goes this way... Uph... Here it is! Brand new, he-he.
Hm. Excellent work! Look, where did you learn that job? Keeping silent? Well, ok, I understand.
Work of a true master! Worth the money, that's for sure!
Can you fix another thing?
Let me see it.\n\nList of items to be repaired:
Barkeep, do you go in for repairing things, I wonder?

Not me myself, frankly speaking. But I've got a stalker clearing his debt to me by working - a real gunsmith. He's very good at fixing barrels and armour, too. I'll give him the job. What do you need to be repaired?
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armour.
Man, I can't afford it right away. Maybe later.
Here, take it. All that could possibly be fixed, has been repaired.
Here, take it. All that could possibly be fixed, has been repaired.
Wow! Like new! Your gunsmith is really good! My best regards to him!
Excellent work, indeed!
Can he fix another item?
Sure he can, he hasn't got much work lately.
Showing.
Do you do repairs, by chance?
Yes, I divert my attention from research work for fixing a device or two. Unfortunately, I haven't got enough tools for that - it's only my hobby, you know - so the repairs will cost a pretty penny.
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armour.
I'm sorry, I haven't got enough money at the moment. I'll drop by later.
Wait a moment...\nWell, I did my best. Here, take it.
It's quite difficult to obtain new armour plates at the moment, but I have some in stock. Wait here...\nHere... As best as I could...
You've done an excellent job! A great gunsmith you could become!
Your conscience is clear! The job has been done for an "A+"!
Could you fix something else, please?
Let's make it quick, while the data is still being processed.
Ok, what else I can do.
Excuse me, I'm here to repair my weaponry. How about your rates?

Ha-ha-ha... Don't worry, you won't have to sell your socks. I'm not the skinflint they suppose me to be. So, what do you want to be repaired? This isn't a cheap thing though, the more the wear is, the higher the price goes. So?
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armour.
I'm short of money... Let's get back to it next time.
I've changed some parts, cleaned and oiled it...\nHave a pleasure using it!

Marked One, are you sure there is no "Shoot here!" mark on your back? Ok, give it here... I'll take a look...\nExclusively for you, brand new armour plates right from the latest supplies! And I've removed the "Shoot here!" mark too, ha-ha.
Good as new! Nice work!
Joker, dammit... Well... it's a pleasure to even look at it now!
Can you repair another thing?
Sure, but don't forget about the money. I'm not doing anything towards next year's payment.
Showing.
I would like to have my weaponry repaired... What about your rates?
Well, though you are the most tough stalker in the Zone, Strelok, I won't repair anything for free for you.
Repair the first weapon.
Repair the second weapon.
Repair the armour.
I don't have enough money now. Lets do it next time.
I've changed some parts, cleaned and oiled it... You are welcome!
I've fixed the armour. Here, take it.
Excellent work!
Excellent work!
Can you fix another thing?
Sure, just make sure you don't forget to pay.
Of course.
Listen, can you repair my stuff?
Of course, but it ain't free, you know.
Repair first gun.
Repair second gun.
Repair outfit.
I'm out of money... May be next time.
Replaced some spare parts, greased and cleaned... Here you go!
Reapired you outfti... Don't waste it!
Good work!
Excellent work!
Can you fix another one?
Of coutse, if you'll pay for it.
Got it.
Sidorovich, can you repair equipment?

Is this about the vice? No, that's not my sort of thing. Luckily for you there's a guy in this village who can help you. Zbirni is the name, he's in one of the basements. Talk to him, he can do all sorts of fancy stuff to guns.
Zbirni the Jew, or what?
Huh? What's the difference? Are you anti-semitic or something?
Oh no...
Ah yes, I've met him already.
Hello, young man!
And good health to you, too. Do you work with weapons?

That's right. Mikhail Anatolievich Zbirni is the name. I provide the whole range of services: quick and qualitative repair of any complexity, spare parts and accessories in stock, all for reasonable prices. Prices are final! No bartering!
Understood.
So... they say you're a gunrunner?

Do you, young man, have the money to behave like this? Ha, "they say"... And what is it? And let them try to prove it! Mikhail Anatolievich Zvirni has a full range of repair services of any complexity, spare parts and accessories in stock and under the order... For a reasonable price, of course.
Hello, young man.
Hi.
What brings you?
Do you take special orders?
Of course, I have all sorts of connections. But I warn you, my exclusive items are not cheap, and I require payment upfront.
What exactly are you interested in?
Interested in anything specific?
God forbid! Of course not!
Okay, I see...
Okay, I'll wait.
Is my order ready?
How would I know what you want from a poor Jew?
Young man, be patient!
I agree, here's the money!
It's too expensive.
I need a vertical foregrip.
I want a vertical foregrip for my Stechkin pistol.
I haven't decided yet...
I need a foregrip with a NATO mount.
Consider it yours for only 2,000! Note that I need time to make an adapter for the Stechkin.
Consider it yours for only 4,000! Put it on the bottom mounted picatinny rail. You'll find the weapon becomes much easier to control.
Always in such a hurry! Well, you'll have to wait. It's not ready yet.
Yes, take it!
I need a scope.
I'm so sorry, but all I've got is what you see here.
Oh, so grab your stuff and go! Turn the corner to the right, then go straight to the very edge, and there to the left of the path will see Sidorovich's bunker...
Why would I want Sidorovich? I need a scope!
Well, if you don't want anything I have then go see what Sidorovich has.
I need something fixed.
Well? Show me.
Here, see what you can do.
Yeah... this isn't going to be cheap.
The gun is ready, here take it.
Here, I fixed your gun.
Nice work!
Thank you, better than new!
Will you fix something else?
If you're paying, I'm fixing.
Can you improve my weapons?

Imagine that! I do all sorts of weapons upgrades, too. 
I can, for example, add a dovetail scope mount to any Kalashnikov rifle. This will allow you to use any local scopes on your AK, like the PSO-1, the somewhat newer 1P29, the Kobra red dot, whatever you find. You can also install a picatinny scope mount over it, like the MTK-83 optic base which I sell, which will allow you to use fancy western optics on your AK. %c[255,255,118,118](This is applicable to the AKMS, AK-74, AKS-74U, AEK-973S, 9A-91, VSK-94, VSS Vintorez, and SR-3M only - To upgrade, equip those weapons and have them out when talking to Gunner, and remove any upgrades)%c[default] 
I can also replace the standard furniture on the AK-102 with a fancier western furniture kit from the west, complete with a picatinny railed handguard. This will increase ergonomics and thus handling, although you won't be able to install the GP-25 grenade launcher anymore. 
You don't appear to have any such weapons, however.

Imagine that! I do all sorts of weapons upgrades, too. \nI can, for example, add a dovetail scope mount to any Kalashnikov rifle. This will allow you to use any local scopes on your AK, like the PSO-1, the somewhat newer 1P29, the Kobra red dot, whatever you find. You can also install a picatinny scope mount over it, like the MTK-83 optic base which I sell, which will allow you to use fancy western optics on your AK. This is a 2,000 ruble job, and 500 if you would like the MTK-83 picatinny rail mount. Dirt cheap! %c[255,255,118,118](This is applicable to the AKMS, AK-74, AKS-74U, AEK-973S, 9A-91, VSK-94, VSS Vintorez, and SR-3M only)%c[default]

Imagine that! I do all sorts of weapons upgrades, too. \nreplace the standard furniture on the AK-102 with a fancier western furniture kit from the west, complete with a picatinny railed handguard. This will increase ergonomics and thus handling, although you won't be able to install a GP-25 grenade launcher anymore. \nThis is 2,000 rubles for the basic modification and 1,500 for a vertical foregrip to go along with it. Basically nothing!
Imagine that! I do all sorts of weapons upgrades, too. \n%c[255,255,118,118](This option is not implemented yet)%c[default]
Sounds awesome! Here's the money.
Consider it a deal!
Imagine that! I do all sorts of weapons upgrades, too. Your gun already looks modified though, not much else I can do to that.
Hmm... this is a rather expensive luxury. I'll think about it.
Well, alright...
I need to make an order.
I need a scope adapter.
For NATO optics.
For a pistol.
I can recommend the good old MTK-83 - put this adapter onto any dovetail mount, and then you can use any western optic. Unfortunately, I'm sold out at the moment.

One MTK-83 coming right up. That'll be 7,000 rubles. Attach this to any dovetail mount and then you can use western optics. Most find them preferable since they're generally more advanced and reliable, I must admit. Hence the heftier price tag, not to mention import fees.

What, do you think you can make this a marksman rifle? I'd suggest this rail mount, and using something like an Aimpoint red dot sight. No magnification, quicker target acquisition. But I have some bad news, young man; we need the profit, but we don't sell pork!

That'll be 10,000 rubles. Attach this rail mount to a pistol such as a Glock, and then I recommend an Aimpoint Micro H-1 red dot sight. \n%c[255,255,118,118](This only works on the Glock 18 pistol)%c[default] \nBut you're going to have to wait a few days until my next shipment comes in.
I need a silencer.
PBS-1
Now why do you want to use that with hypersonic ammo?...
I've changed my mind.
Isn't there any way you can get it for me?

I'm sorry, but there are no subsonic rounds in the area. For this reason, specialist stalkers prefer 9x39 mm weapons for the job. Or 12.7x55 if they can get their hands on them... but good luck with that.
Well, I guess I'm gonna have to go loud.
It's a pity... and to think you said, "The whole range of services, the whole range of services!"

Well... I could produce my own suppressor, sort of like a TGP inside the body of a PBS-1. It's gonna take a couple of hours and it'll only cost you 5,000. And, most importantly, it can be used with standard ammunition.
Unfortunately, there is very little demand for such exclusive items.
Always in a hurry. Be patient, the job's not ready yet.
Here, take it.
Well, that's not so bad.
Yes! And no cheaper than my reputation!
Oh, "Vintorez"! Nice gun, I'd take it...
Ah, the Vintorez... not a bad weapon, but a specialty item for sure. How about a VSK-94?
Ah, the Vintorez... not a bad weapon, but a specialty item for sure. How about a PB/6P9?
Ah, the Vintorez... not a bad weapon, but a specialty item for sure. How about a Stechkin APB?
PBS-4
TGP-A
ATG
TGP-V
Stechkin APB Silencer
For .45ACP
For NATO assault rifles
%c[255,255,118,118](This option is not implemented yet)%c[default]
%c[255,255,118,118](This option is not implemented yet)%c[default]
For NATO pistols
